name: ALLOCATE FIELD
description: Use this command to change a field previously defined within a program. This command will work only with DEFINE’d fields. The command will allow you to change any part of the field: size, type, etc., even the number of array elements. It is generally used in situations where you don’t know how large a field you might need and don’t want to take up space before it is needed. Also, you can DEALLOC (Array Deallocate) an allocated field during runtime. This capability is useful when you know you need to chain to other programs and might not have enough room if the field is at a set size.
syntax: ALLOC field_name TYPE type SIZE display_size DEC decimal_chrs ARRAY num_array_elements UP up_case PICT picture

parameters.name: field_name
parameters.description: The name of the field being allocated. This field must be previously defined within the program.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the field being allocated. Must conform to standard field type requirements.

parameters.name: display_size
parameters.description: The display size of the field being allocated. Must conform to standard field display size requirements. If this is not included then the default values for the type of field are used.

parameters.name: decimal_chrs
parameters.description: If the field is of type N you can specify the number of decimal characters. If this isn’t included the default value is 0. This could affect the displayed value of the field or the ability to ENTER the correct value. Because this is true, you should take great care to make sure the proper value is used.

parameters.name: num_array_elements
parameters.description: The number of array elements for this field.

parameters.name: up_case
parameters.description: If this is a type ‘A’ field you may specify whether all characters entered to it are to be automatically forced into upper case. To accomplish this, make this value ‘Y’.
